meanings.definition: The act of assigning or designating something to someone.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the coach's assignation of positions helped the team play better.
meanings.sent2: The assignation of tasks in the group project was fair and well-organized.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the assignation of party favors made everyone excited.
meanings.sent4: The assignation of roles in the play turned the students into talented actors.
meanings.sent5: Her assignation of chores to her siblings was met with groans and protests.

meanings.definition: A meeting or appointment, especially a secret one.
meanings.sent1: The assignation between the spies took place in a dimly lit alley.
meanings.sent2: Their assignation at the park was a romantic rendezvous under the stars.
meanings.sent3: The assignation at the library raised suspicions among the curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The assignation in the cafe was a scene straight out of a spy movie.
meanings.sent5: His assignation with the mysterious stranger left him with more questions than answers.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring property or rights to another.
meanings.sent1: The assignation of the deed was a crucial step in finalizing the property sale.
meanings.sent2: Her assignation of the copyright to the company secured her financial future.
meanings.sent3: The assignation of ownership caused a legal dispute between the siblings.
meanings.sent4: The assignation of the company shares marked a new chapter in the business.
meanings.sent5: His assignation of the antique collection to the museum was a generous gesture.
